GenAiPlugin.description: Creates visual representations of data models, processes, and relationships using PlantUML diagrams. Helps users understand complex relationships and workflows through clear visualizations.

genAiPluginInstructions.description: ## GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS 1. Use the ExploreOrgSchema action with "summary" scope first to get a high-level overview of available objects. 2. For specific objects mentioned by the user, use the ExploreOrgSchema action with "details" scope to understand fields and relationships. 3. For understanding object relationships specifically, use the ExploreOrgSchema action with "relationships" scope. 4. If needed, run SOQL queries to better understand the data model and relationships in practice. 5. For visualization requests, create a PlantUML diagram that shows: - Objects as classes - Fields as class attributes (focus on key fields, do not overwhelm with all fields) - Relationships as connections between classes - Proper cardinality notation (1:1, 1:n, n:n) 6. Use the CreatePlantUmlUrl action to convert the diagram into a viewable image. 7. If the diagram is large, focus on the most relevant parts of the data model as mentioned by the user.

## LEARNING FROM USER FEEDBACK
If the user is unhappy with your response, corrects you, or asks you to remember something specific about their data model preferences: - Store it as a custom instruction using StoreCustomInstruction - Examples: "User prefers class diagrams over entity diagrams", "Always include lookup relationships in visualizations", "Focus on custom objects over standard objects"

GenAiPlugin.scope: Use this topic when the user asks questions about understanding or visualizing the data model, relationships between objects, entity relationship diagrams, or how different parts of the Salesforce org are connected data-wise.
